titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Michael Bennett Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday January 23, 2019 at 04:46

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The papers document the musical theater career of Michael Bennett, spanning the dates 1950 to 1989 (with the bulk of the material spanning 1973 to 1986), and consisting of production files, correspondence, business papers, scripts, printed material, personal papers, audiovisual material, objects and photographs. The papers document the process of writing, choreographing, directing, and marketing Broadway musical productions such as Dreamgirls and A Chorus Line. The papers also document Bennett's personal life in the 1970s and 1980s.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

Boxes 52-55, 68-69 (audio and video tapes): Restricted Fragile Material. Access to original audio and video tapes is restricted. Reference copies may be requested. Contact Access Services for further information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Michael Bennett Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Michael Bennett Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collection are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.
The collection received preliminary processing at the time of acquisition. Further organization, rehousing, and description were carried out in 2011.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers document the musical theatre career of Michael Bennett, spanning the dates 1950 to 1989 (with the bulk of the material spanning 1973 to 1986), and consisting of production files, correspondence, business papers, scripts, printed material, personal papers, audiovisual material, objects and photographs. The papers document the process of writing, choreographing, directing, and marketing Broadway musical productions such as Dreamgirls and A Chorus Line . The papers also document Bennett's personal life in the 1970s and 1980s.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three series: I. Production Files, Professional Papers, and Personal Papers, 1950-1987. II. Awards and Objects, 1970-1989. III. Audiovisual Material, 1966-circa 1986.

bioghist.head: Michael Bennett, 1943-1987
bioghist.p: American musical theater director and choreographer Michael Bennett was born Michael DiFiglia in Buffalo, New York in 1943. Bennett began his Broadway career as a dancer and later found success as a choreographer and director. Bennett won seven Tony Awards for his choreography and direction of Broadway shows, and was nominated for eleven more. Bennett is best known for his work on Promises, Promises , Dreamgirls , A Chorus Line , Ballroom , Company and Follies . Bennett died of AIDS-related lymphoma in 1987.

did.unittitle: Production Files, Professional Papers, and Personal Papers

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Files are grouped together by production title, format, or topic, but otherwise are not arranged in any particular order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series I consists of production files for Broadway shows and other professional and personal papers. Production files pertain to the musicals and plays on which Bennett worked, and include scripts, financial and legal records, contracts, marketing material, photographs, newspaper clippings, playbills, and other related material. Professional papers include correspondence and other papers relating to Bennett's work on Broadway, and also to professional organizations and associations, studios and theatres, and labor relations. Personal papers contain personal correspondence, household maintenance files, financial papers, and diaries and daily calendars.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Most files pertain to national and international tours of A Chorus Line .

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Not arranged in any particular order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series II contains awards and objects owned by Michael Bennett, relating to his theatre career. Included are Tony Award nominations and trophies, Drama Desk awards, Los Angeles Drama Critics awards, and other awards. The series also includes objects presented to Bennett in recognition of his role in various Broadway productions as well as a few photograph albums relating to Broadway productions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Pulizter Prize for A Chorus Line .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series III contains audiovisual materials recording live performances on stage and television, as well as commercial recordings of soundtracks and movie productions.

did.unittitle: "Oh Brother" cast album with Judy Kaye, Alan Weeks, D.J. Carrol, Harry Groner, and Joe Morton. Peter Hammer - drums

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A handwritten note is included with this audiocassette. It reads: Dear Michael, I thought that I would send you a tape of the "Oh Brother" album so you could hear what I've been up to lately. It was recorded last October so it is a fairly recent example. Anyway I hope you enjoy it and it disproves all of the nasty things that Messers. Thomas and Tunick say about my playing. Thanks, Peter
